title: Nodes are not syncing from inside the same server
body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging docs: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Monitor/Logging/ -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3Ahyperledger/Besu -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
I'm trying to create a new network using IBFT2.0 in an EC2 instance that belongs to Tencent Cloud and Alibaba Cloud, I've created a main node, which is node-1  and node-2, and now trying to connect the node-2 with the main node using enode URL with the public IP address but the node-2 is not catching up the peer whereas my all related nodes are open.
Moreover, it only connects with the localhost if using the same server for 4 nodes or a private IP address if the node is in another EC2 instance with the same VPC or security group and in the same region but not connecting with the public IP address to access the main node (genesis node ) globally ( from any region cloud is offering )

There are some details in the following :

1. Here is my main command for node-1

 **`besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../genesis.json --rpc-http-enabled=true --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,WEB3,TRACE,IBFT --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins="all"--p2p-enabled=true --p2p-host=public-ip  --p2p-interface=0.0.0.0 --rpc-http-host=0.0.0.0 --rpc-http-port=8545 --min-gas-price=0 --rpc-ws-host=0.0.0.0  --rpc-ws-port=6174 --rpc-ws-enabled=false --rpc-ws-api=ETH,NET,WEB3,TRACE,IBFT --rpc-http-max-active-connections=2147483647`**

generated  enode url  with the public ip given in --p2p-host=public-ip and with default port (30303). 
`enode://cad0271460aa21f7f9c62e73a92100f695cd63ce0c8d10971b812d8df45d898ae57a32b183959305f11421c7928889cc2e4357633f5b189dfb73da16e53286fd@public-ip:30303`

2.  Command for node-2 

**`besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../genesis.json --bootnodes=enode://cad0271460aa21f7f9c62e73a92100f695cd63ce0c8d10971b812d8df45d898ae57a32b183959305f11421c7928889cc2e4357633f5b189dfb73da16e53286fd@public-ip:30303 --p2p-port=30304 --rpc-http-enabled=true --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,TRACE  --host-allowlist="*"  --rpc-http-cors-origins="all"  --rpc-http-host=0.0.0.0  --rpc-http-port=8546 --min-gas-price=0  --rpc-ws-host=0.0.0.0  --rpc-ws-port=6175  --rpc-ws-enabled=true  --rpc-ws-api=ETH,NET,TRACE   --rpc-http-max-active-connections=2147483647`** 

but still node are not syncing with each other whether its in the same server 


### Acceptance Criteria
* [Criteria 1]

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. [Create a fresh node named node-1 from scratch and save the enode URL and public IP address of the server/instance]
2. [Run the Node-2 by passing the enode URL generated from node-1 and pass the public IP at the end of the Enode URL instead of localhost or private IP address]


**Expected behavior:**  Node should be synced and catch the peer counts as per running nodes count.

**Actual behavior:** 4 Initial nodes are running but not syncing with each other peer count is zero. 

**Frequency:** I've tried it over 2 clouds but all in vane.
### Logs (if a bug)
Please post relevant logs from Besu (and the consensus client, if running proof of stake) from before and after the issue. 

1. **Logs from Node-1**

```

2. **Logs from Node-2** 

```
**2023-08-29 16:04:23.617+08:00 | EthScheduler-Timer-0 | INFO  | FullSyncTargetManager | No sync target, waiting for peers. Current peers: 0

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`besu 22.7.2 `]
* Java version: [`java openjdk-11-jdk`]
* OS Name & Version: [` Ubuntu 20.04 LTS`]
* Kernel Version: [`Linux VM-0-2-ubuntu 5.4.0-153-generic`]
* Virtual Machine software & version: [`vmware -v`] not using 
* Docker Version: [`docker version`] not using 
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Alibaba  and Tencent cloud]
* Consensus Client & Version if using Proof of Stake: [e.g. Teku, Lighthouse, Prysm, Nimbus, Lodestar]

### Smart contract information (If you're reporting an issue arising from deploying or calling a smart contract, please supply related information)
* Solidity version [`solc --version`]
* Repo with minimal set of deployable/reproducible contract code - please provide a link
* Please include specifics on how you are deploying/calling the contract 
* Have you reproduced the issue on other eth clients

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
* Besu setup info - genesis file, config options
* System info - memory  1024 Gb, CPU 8 cores with 16 Gb Ram

### The issue is resolved, 
you have to add some extra flags in the main config command to run the main node, at the time of launching the EC2 instance don't attach the default security group and VPC to it. 
This is for the Alibaba and Tencent Clouds, All you have to do is enable the p2p and specify the p2p port other than the default (in my case port is 30303) add these flags in the main command. 

### i.e **`besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../genesis.json --rpc-http-enabled=true --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,TRACE,IBFT --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins="all"   --p2p-enabled=true --p2p-host=0.0.0.0  --rpc-http-host=0.0.0.0 --rpc-http-port=8545 --min-gas-price=0 --rpc-ws-host=0.0.0.0  --rpc-ws-port=6174 --rpc-ws-enabled=false --rpc-ws-api=ETH,NET,TRACE,IBFT --rpc-http-max-active-connections=2147483647`**


```
--p2p-enabled=true,
--p2p-host=0.0.0.0  allows all IPs you can specify the IP address.
```
Moreover, If you are using Alibaba Cloud there is no need to add the **p2p port** against the **UDP IPV6  protocol,** you can **only add the UDP IPV4 and the TCP protocol** along with the **p2p port**. 

If you are using AWS you can follow the official [documentation for Configure ports  ](https://besu.hyperledger.org/23.4.0/public-networks/how-to/connect/configure-ports#p2p-networking) of BESU.


For Tencent Cloud users, you have to follow the same thing as mentioned for Alibaba but with the following syntax.

**UPD:Port number => UDP:30303 in my case** 
**TCP:port number => TCP:30303 in my case**

Thanks for responding with the resolution @UsmArs :)
Glad you managed to sort it. Is it OK to close this issue now?

> Thanks for responding with the resolution @UsmArs :) Glad you managed to sort it. Is it OK to close this issue now?

Glad to hear that from you @siladu! yes, we can close the issue for sure!
